items.title: 'No Kings' protest crowds gather across the US against Donald Trump's leadership
items.summary: Organisers say the rallies reflect frustration over the Trump administration's prosecutions of the president's perceived enemies, immigration raids and the sending of troops into US cities.

items.title: Aussie Bird Count brings together students, photographers and nature-lovers
items.summary: A primary school teacher is getting her students involved in a volunteer-led bird count, to gather a snapshot of birds across the country.

items.title: Mural of Sydney's queer history removed from Surry Hills Police Station days after going up
items.summary: The artwork, Queer Sydney: A History, was hung at Surry Hills Police Station, metres from where the annual Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras parade is held.

items.title: 'Gellung Warl' and other Victorian Aboriginal words that are part of Australia's first Treaty
items.summary: Victoria's first Treaty with First Peoples' was debated in state parliament last week. The Treaty introduces some Victorian Aboriginal words you may not have heard before — here's how to say them and what they mean.

items.title: Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri crash in Formula 1 US Grand Prix sprint race
items.summary: Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris have once again made contact with each other in a Formula 1 race, this time taking each other out at the sprint race of the US Grand Prix, just two weeks after their collision in Singapore.

items.title: How Mother Teresa helped Steve Waugh channel his 'power' for children in need
items.summary: When Steve Waugh retired from cricket, he knew he wanted to use his influence to make a difference. It was meeting Mother Teresa that made him realise his new path.

items.title: China's 'special forces'-style tourists packing big itineraries in small budgets
items.summary: Young Chinese tourists with limited time and money are travelling 'special forces'-style — inspired by the efficiency, endurance, and intensity of military units.

items.title: After Ukraine, Finland hopes it won't be Putin's next target
items.summary: Blasted into the bedrock, deep below the streets of Helsinki, these massive bunkers are currently used for recreation. Their primary function, however, is much more sinister: preparing for a Russian invasion.

items.title: Hard Quiz Kids: Who says trivia is just for grown-ups? It's time to put your thinking cap on
items.summary: Hard Quiz Kids is here again, and we're gifting you a bunch of straightforward questions. Don't embarrass yourself.

items.title: Native mussel restoration project supported by Victor Harbor community
items.summary: Victor Harbor was one of the first areas affected by SA's harmful algal bloom. Now its citizens are funding and supporting research into rebuilding native mussel populations as it looks to the future.

items.title: BOM's first long-range summer forecast shows increased chance of extreme heat
items.summary: Hot nights coupled with high daytime temperatures could see Australia heading into an extremely hot summer, BOM's first long-range forecast indicates.

items.title: Anthony Albanese is set to sit down with Donald Trump. What can he learn from other world leaders?
items.summary: As other world leaders have discovered, a visit to Donald Trump's White House can become an unpredictable, if not uncomfortable, encounter.

items.title: The deep Indigenous history of Australia deserves to be up in lights

items.title: China's economic slowdown has become its diplomatic weapon in the Pacific
items.summary: For Australia and the US, the Pacific is no longer a comfortable backyard — it's a battleground of credibility.

items.title: Death doulas, family-led funerals and the deathcare movement hope to change the way we die
items.summary: For many, voluntary assisted dying has come to symbolise control over how life ends. Yet dying well isn't just about those final hours. That's where a deathwalker like Zenith can help.

items.title: Israel identifies remains of 10th hostage handed over by Hamas as 76-year-old Eliyahu Margalit
items.summary: Eliyahu Margalit's body was found after two bulldozers ploughed up pits in the earth in the city of Khan Younis.

items.title: Jack Miller eyeing breakthrough MotoGP podium at Australian Grand Prix
items.summary: Jack Miller qualifies in the front row for Sunday's Australian Grand Prix — the first Aussie to do so since Casey Stoner in 2012.

items.title: Jamie Melham creates Caulfield Cup history after riding Half Yours to victory
items.summary: Jamie Melham breaks new ground as the first female jockey to win the Caulfield Cup in its 149-year history, steering favourite Half Yours to victory in the $5 million handicap.

items.title: Collingwood cult hero Mason Cox not offered new contract for 2026 AFL season
items.summary: Mason Cox, the first American to become an AFL regular, confirms he will not be with the Magpies in 2026.

items.title: Chinese Communist Party's Central Committee set for major shake-up at plenum meeting
items.summary: A key meeting of the Chinese Communist Party Central Committee is expected to include a major shake-up of President Xi Jinping's inner circle.

items.title: NT chief minister claims tough-on-crime approach has led to 'significant' crime drop
items.summary: NT Chief Minister Lia Finocchiaro says the Country Liberal Party's tough-on-crime approach "is working". But after two teens broke into a play centre and left a trail of destruction, operator Steve Mason is not convinced.

items.title: Ka Ying Rising wins $20 million The Everest at Randwick
items.summary: Ka Ying Rising produces a storming finish to claim victory in the world's richest horse race, The Everest.

items.title: Kangaroos defeat Crows by 40-points to move closer to winning record as Saints, Dockers and Demons notch victories
items.summary: North Melbourne moves one victory away from equalling the all-time VFL/AFL and AFLW winning record with a 40-point drubbing of Adelaide as St Kilda moves closer to a maiden finals appearance.

items.title: Barnaby Joyce hasn't quit the Nationals yet but he's got one foot out the door
items.summary: In declaring he won't be recontesting his lower house seat and letting speculation run that he might jump ship for One Nation, Barnaby Joyce is declaring he's had enough with the Nationals under David Littleproud.

items.title: Who is Prince Andrew? Why is he giving up his royal title?
items.summary: The third-born child of Queen Elizabeth II will still be referred to as a prince and is expected to continue living in his Windsor mansion.

items.title: Shohei Ohtani dominates to send Dodgers through to World Series after defeating Brewers
items.summary: Shohei Ohtani propels the Los Angeles Dodgers back to the World Series with a two-way performance for the ages to clinch the National League Championship.

items.title: Gungahlin United Football Club to fold after losing NPL licence, leaving 2,000 grassroots players club-less
items.summary: Just last year, the club won the league, and a former president was jailed for stealing $20k. Now they are going to fold.

items.title: Anti-bullying report outlines national strategy to crack down on behaviour
items.summary: Australian schools will need to initiate action against a bullying complaint within two days of a reported incident as part of a new national plan to tackle bullying.

items.title: Trump commutes former Republican George Santos's federal fraud jail sentence
items.summary: George Santos, a former Republican Congressman who is serving more than seven years in a US prison, was charged with stealing from donors, fraud and lying to Congress.

items.summary: Tom French's agoraphobia meant he couldn't leave the house to access the mental health care he needed, but a Hospital in the Home program means the care is coming to him.

items.summary: Tear gas and stun grenades were used to disperse hundreds of protesters who were calling for more provisions for those who helped oust the former government of Sheikh Hasina.

items.summary: The US military has launched six strikes on Venezuelan vessels the Trump administration claims were involved in drugs trafficking, and some are warning the intervention is threatening to spark an all-out war.

items.summary: The Ukrainian president offers the US thousands of military drones in exchange for American Tomahawk missiles, but Donald Trump says he wants to end the war "without thinking about Tomahawks".

items.title: Ways to increase safety on a first date and red flags to watch for

items.title: 'No doubt' Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump will discuss critical minerals: Chalmers

items.summary: Joshua's "passion project" with a radio scanner led to one of WA's most significant public health data breaches. His story highlights the challenges confronting autistic people caught up in the legal system.

items.summary: The resolution of negotiations between Australian mining giant BHP and China's state-backed iron ore buyer China Mineral Resources Group could reshape not just the resources industry, but also international trade flows, global markets, and the relationship between China and the West.

items.title: ASX slips as gold price surges to new record above $US4,300 — as it happened

items.summary: There is general agreement in Labor that Jim Chalmers is the government's best communicator. But insiders watching this race know Tony Burke is the master tactician.

items.summary: "Dangerously low" arts sector funding has rendered the Tasmanian industry "highly vulnerable", with funding stagnant since 2016-17, the state government has conceded.

items.summary: The US passport has fallen to 12th place, a five-spot decline from its previous ranking, tying with Malaysia.

items.summary: With success at home and abroad, Annabel Kennedy is part of a growing number of Australian women and girls making their mark in motorsport.

items.title: Researchers have counted superb fairy-wrens at National Botanical Gardens for 40 years — 2025 was 'confronting'
items.summary: The ACT's superb fairy-wren population has declined by 60 per cent since counting began in the 1980s, but this last winter the figures were even worse, new research has revealed.
